title: Research
text:
Working Paper
Who Enforces Matters: Evidence from Insider-Trading Cases
Zihan (Zoe) Tang
We assemble a micro-level case × team × defendant dataset (2011–2024) from SEC Litigation Releases and linked biographical sources to study how frontline enforcement-team composition relates to nine defendant-level outcomes (civil and criminal). Using Elastic-Net screening with post-selection OLS and two-way clustering, preliminary patterns suggest professionally balanced teams (investigation, accounting/forensics, data, trial) are associated with stronger criminal channels (parallel actions, incarceration) and larger monetary relief, controlling for venue and scale of illegal gains.
Status: preliminary; robustness and alternative specifications ongoing.
